messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Right to Life Marching on the Courthouse
messages.msgSnippet: While I think this is a valuable item for discussion, I have to say that IMHO, it doesn t belong here. Elissa, who will soon be singing Yippee - Kai - Yay!
messages.messageBody:
While I think this is a valuable item for discussion, I have to say that
IMHO, it doesn't belong here.
Elissa, who will soon be singing
Yippee - Kai - Yay!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Right to Life Marching on the Courthouse
messages.msgSnippet: ... If some clinic were euthanizing 2 year olds just because the mother asked it to be done, would you try to stop it? From the point of view that life begins
messages.messageBody:
on 1/23/02 10:37 AM, casaloco02 at casaloco02@... wrote:

> I never understood this action. If they don't like abortions, they
> don't have to get one.

If some clinic were euthanizing 2 year olds just because the mother asked it
to be done, would you try to stop it?

From the point of view that life begins at conception, the two are
equivalent.

Joyce


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Right to Life Marching on the Courthouse
messages.msgSnippet: On Wed, 23 Jan 2002 15:37:52 -0000 casaloco02  ... I wasn t going to get into this one, but I have to respond to this. It s just the
messages.messageBody:
On Wed, 23 Jan 2002 15:37:52 -0000 "casaloco02" <casaloco02@...>
writes:
> >Today the pro-life ladies are marching<
>
> I never understood this action. If they don't like abortions, they
> don't have to get one.

I wasn't going to get into this one, but I have to respond to this. It's
just the stupidest argument, IMO. Would you tell someone "If you don't
like child abuse, don't abuse your child?" or "If you don't like murders,
don't murder anyone"?

Dar

messages.subject: Right to Life Marching on the Courthouse
messages.msgSnippet: ... I never understood this action. If they don t like abortions, they don t have to get one. I wouldn t want one for my dw or for either of my dd. I would try
messages.messageBody:
>Today the pro-life ladies are marching<

I never understood this action. If they don't like abortions, they
don't have to get one.

I wouldn't want one for my dw or for either of my dd. I would try to
support them in whatever decision they made though. But then, if one
of my daughters turned out like Madonna, I would love them and I
think many parents might not.

Abortions were "outlawed" by a Roman Catholic clergy in an attempt to
increase the number of members, I heard. So every anti-abortionist
who protests against others' abortions is behaving as a Roman.

What if there were anti-homeschoolers who protested against parents
who kept their kids at home for religious reasons? Live and let
live, or suffer the consequences because what goes around comes
around.
